pages.text: Getting Genes is a rather involved process.

First, you'll need the $(l:geneticsresequenced:items/scraper)Scraper/$. This tool can be used on entities to collect $(l:geneticsresequenced:items/organic_matter)Organic Matter/$ from them.$(br2)The Organic Matter will have the entity's type attached. This is what decides what Genes you can get from it.

Craft a $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/cell_analyzer)Cell Analyzer/$, and process the Organic Matter through it. This will create a $(l:geneticsresequenced:items/cell)Cell/$.$(br2)Like the Organic Matter, this has the entity's type attached.

Craft a $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/dna_extractor)DNA Extractor/$, and process the Cell through it. This will create a $(l:geneticsresequenced:items/dna_helix)DNA Helix/$, which carries an unknown Gene.$(br2)To find out what Gene it is, you'll need to process it through a $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/dna_decryptor)DNA Decryptor/$.

Some entities have $(minor)several Genes/$ that they can give. This is a weighted choice, with some Genes being more common than others.$(br2)You can see the chance of each in JEI.$(br2)All DNA Helices have a chance of being $(bad)Basic/$, which contains no Gene.$(br2)This does not make it useless, however. We'll come back to that in a moment.

Now that you have some decrypted DNA Helices, you have to inject them into a $(l:geneticsresequenced:items/plasmid)Plasmid/$.$(br2)This is done at the $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/plasmid_infuser)Plasmid Infuser/$.$(br2)For more information on that, see the Plasmid's page, linked above.

Craft a $(l:geneticsresequenced:items/syringe)Syringe/$, and use it to extract some of your own blood.$(br2)Pass it through a $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/blood_purifier)Blood Purifier/$ to decontaminate it.$(br2)Then, you can combine it and the completed Plasmid in a $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/plasmid_injector)Plasmid Injector/$ to add the Gene to the Syringe.

You can add as many Genes to the Syringe as you like. When you're ready, $(minor)inject the blood back into yourself/$ to gain all the Genes!$(br2)Be warned, some Genes may $(bad)require other Genes/$ to be able to be injected. These Genes are called $(l:geneticsresequenced:intro/mutation)Mutations/$. Trying to inject them without the requisite Genes will result in dire consequences.
